page.title: 01LILLESHALL/SHERIFFHALES
page.content: The area is predominantly rural with population being centred in the villages of Sheriffhales in the S.E. and Lilleshall in the N.W. There are several farms which are given over primarily to dairy cattle. The landscape is mainly undulating with a general rise towards the S. and the old East Shropshire coalfield. Up umtil the beginning of the 20th. century the land was owned by the Duke of Sutherland and many of the older houses retain their character although an influx of newer 'outsiders' has meant much alteration and renovation. Although many people are still connected with farming a large number of the newer inhabitants work further afield in Shropshire and the West Midlands. The National Sports Centre at Lilleshall Hall is well known much further afield.
